wikipedia_page.main: William Arundell Bouverie (b Marylebone 6 February 1797 - d Denton, Norfolk 23 August 1877) was Archdeacon of Norfolk from 1850 until 1869.Nevill was educated at Christ Church, Oxford. Later he was a Fellow at Merton. He was ordained in 1822.  He held livings at Hambledon, Surrey, Holywell, Oxford, West Tytherley and Denton, Norfolk.

response: * Frances Sneyd (1798–1884), who married William Arundell Bouverie, the Archdeacon of Norfolk who was a son of Bartholomew Bouverie and grandson of William Bouverie, 1st Earl of Radnor, in 1831. Frances was maid of honour to Queen Adelaide.
